title: 2.5D Geometry Class
description: Add support for 2.5d geometry classes for area unification both visual and physical.

title: 890 Jump Mission Update
description: Update the Origin 890 Jump missions to support body dragging. This will enable the player to drag an unconscious NPC into a ship in the cargo hold to extract them. Includes both lawful and unlawful mission variants.

title: Achievement Service
description: This service is responsible for the lifecycle and management of Game Achievements.

title: Aciedo Station
description: Aciedo is a station created by Aciedo CommRelay, a Human corporation that manufactures and maintains interstellar communications equipment.

title: Actor Status T2
description: Actor Status Tier 2 looks at a variety of new elements such as hygiene, NPC status tracking, multiple bites, DNA integrity, medical insurance, cybernetic limbs and cloning.

title: Adapt Spawn Closets to Support Persistent NPC Spawning
description: Tasks to update the Spawn Closet feature to work with the NPC scheduler service.

title: Aegis Gladius Gold Standard
description: Implementing, polishing, and optimizing all features required to bring the Aegis Gladius up to gold standard.

title: Aegis Idris
description: Crafted by Aegis Dynamics, the Idris is the standard frigate used by the United Empire of Earth Navy (UEEN).

title: Aegis Javelin Destroyer
description: Encompasses all tasks, including design, art, audio, and tech required for the implementation of the Aegis Javelin Destroyer.

title: Aegis Redeemer
description: Encompasses all tasks, including design, art, audio, and tech, required for the implementation of the Aegis Redeemer gunship into the PU.

card.title: Aegis Redeemer
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the Aegis Redeemer gunship

title: Aegis Retaliator Gold Standard
description: Implementing, polishing, and optimizing all features required to bring the Aegis Retaliator up to gold standard.

title: Aerodynamic Control Surfaces
description: Ships with control surfaces will be able to use them in atmospheres to aid their maneuverability. This will allow for improved performance from ships that have weak maneuvering thrusters in atmosphere, and bring new depth to aerodynamic flight in the game.

title: AI - Dancing
description: Dancing is a segment of our new civilian AI leisure behavior. After work, some civilians will have the urge to spend time at a nightclub and dance the night away. This will bring new life and movement to our bars.

title: AI - Ground Vehicles
description: This is the first pass on supporting NPCs controlling and driving ground vehicles. This requires the implementation of a new pathfollower that can take care of the vehicle's physical abilities to transform the NPCs movement request into actual movement.

title: AI - Hawker
description: Encompasses all tasks for implementing the Hawker NPC type into the persistent universe.

title: AI - Illegal Goods Dealer
description: The ‘Goods Dealer’ is a new roaming ‘Vendor’ AI behaviour that brokers illegal products, located mostly wandering around shadowy and secretive areas, this dealer trades without a license or permission and is always on the lookout for security.

title: AI - Janitor
description: Encompasses all tasks for implementing the Janitor NPC type into the persistent universe.

title: AI - Landing Improvements
description: This enables AI ships to land and deliver reinforcements on non-structured ground areas like planetary terrain where a pre-defined landing area and assistance from Air Traffic Control is not available.

title: AI - Leisure
description: The leisure behavior is a segment of our new civilian behavior system, controlling how the AI behaves when they have free time during their schedule. AI will create a lifelike environment by relaxing and having fun, using the things that are available to them, such as exercise equipment, jogging routes, TV monitors, seats/benches, and their mobiGlas.

title: AI - Medical
description: Implementing a variety of medical AI behaviors. A patient will arrive at the hospital and check themselves in at a terminal then wait to be seen called to a room for a diagnosis. The patient can then see doctors and nurses tending to sick and injured people. Other patients will wait to be called. Doctors and nurses can be seen washing their hands, checking medical stock and dispensing medicine. Some patients will be asleep in medical beds.

card.title: Doctor, Nurse AI Behaviors
card.description: Adding more realistic behaviors and reactions for Doctors and Nurses

title: AI - Navigation Links - Elevators/Transit
description: Implementing special adapters to inform the navigation system of potential navmesh connections offered by elevators and transit. Those systems will create potential connections that rely on specific additional conditions to be met (the presence of a train, an elevator and so on). NPCs will be able to use those connections and understand when the appropriate exit point is reached.

title: AI - Navigation Links - Ladders/Ledge Grab
description: Implementing special adapters to allow the navigation system to be informed of potential navmesh connections offered by ladders or ledge grab markup. The navigation links already allowed the creation of adapters that contain gamecode specific functionality to function as sort of translators between system-specific domain into the navigation system.

title: AI - Off Duty Activities - Hygiene
description: The sleeping behavior is a segment of our new civilian behavior system, making the AI feel more realistic by scheduling toilet breaks, sometimes washing hands, and increasing hygiene values by taking daily showers.

title: AI - Off Duty Activities - Sleeping
description: The sleeping behavior is a segment of our new civilian behavior system, controlling how the AI sleeps, relaxes, and socializes in bed. We will support single beds, bunk beds and beds with privacy shutters in this first iteration.

title: AI - Planetary Navigation
description: First pass at a system that allows NPCs to move on planetary surfaces using a dynamically generated navigation mesh. This will efficiently process planetary terrain and objects to prioritize the processing of the environment around the players into navmesh, allowing us to use all the existing functionalities on planets.

title: AI - Trolley Push & Pull
description: This will be the first pass on implementing the ability for NPCs to use trolleys and trolley-like entities. They will be able to move in the environment pushing and pulling those entities to place them from/to specific locations. This requires the creation of a special pathfollower that can take into consideration external forces that needs to be balanced to achieve the desired speed.

title: AI - Turret Gunner
description: Encompasses all tasks for implementing the Turret Gunner NPC type into the persistent universe.

title: AI - Unmanned Missile Turrets
description: Adding AI controlled missile turrets to improve defense of green zones.

title: AI - Untrained Combat
description: First iteration for untrained characters (such as civilians) to react in battle scenarios. Civilian AI will be able to use weapons to defend themselves in threatening situations, and will try to preserve their lives using cover or surrendering when necessary.

title: AI EVA Tech
description: AI will be able to navigate via EVA in open space to appropriate points of interest and will allow the AI to transition from seat to EVA when requested or when appropriate.

title: AI Info Service
description: Currently, Odin and other backend tools that display player or NPC locations route through ElasticSearch, which is CIG's analytics pipeline. This process is naturally slow, and the amount of high-fidelity data we need to track is low enough to make a separate service practical. This new service will continuously track the position of players, NPCs, and other entities so that our live-service tools can display them properly in real-time.

title: Akiro Cluster
description: Adding the Akiro Cluster, a cluster of dangerous, charred asteroids. While mostly worthless, some rare materials can be found here.

title: Animatable Gunner Helmet
description: Creating an animated and EVA-capable version of the gunner helmet.

title: Archon
description: Archon Station is a large space station located inside The Coil.

title: Area 18 - Hospital Interior Location
description: Area 18 hospital interior where players can heal, revive, and purchase medical supplies and life insurance.

card.title: Area 18 Hospital
card.description: Hospital interior located in the Area 18 landing zone

title: Area 18 Hospital Staff Outfits
description: Implementing variant outfits and loadouts for the staff of Area 18 hospitals.

title: Asset Manager
description: In support of localized inventories, the Asset Manager keeps track of all player-owned items, where they're stored, and where they need to go to pick up, transfer, and equip them.

card.title: Asset Manager mobiGlas App
card.description: Adding the Asset Manager mobiGlas App to help players manage their belongings

title: Asset Reference Database
description: Create a tool to track relationships and dependencies between assets and produce asset graphs showing how an in-game entity is composed. This will allow improvements to the build system and easier asset management.

title: Asset Specific ADIK Targets - Maya
description: Implementation of a new maya workflow featuring a streamlined user interface for authoring asset specific ADIK targets that can be exported to engine on a per-animation basis.

title: Asset Validator
description: Replacement for the existing Asset Validator to provide extensible test plug-ins, improved performance, and clearer error reporting.

title: ATC Service
description: The logic for Air Traffic Control is handled separately on each DGS (Dedicated Game Server). As we move closer to the reality of Server Meshing, the logic for Air Traffic Control needs to transition to a separate service.

title: ATC System Rewrite
description: Rewrite the ATC system to utilize a backend service, making it compatible with server meshing.

title: Atlas
description: Add functionality to the Hybrid for what will become the Atlas component service of the Replication Layer. Atlas functionality splits the game up into multiple manageble regions (known as territories) which are then provided to the Replicant functions Dedicated Game Servers (DGS) by the Replicant Hybrid  to manage and simulate.

title: Atmospheric Pressure Damage
description: Atmospheric Pressure Damage is the damage players/NPCs or ships will receive in situations where the exterior pressure exceeds the pressure resistance of the corresponding ship/armor/suit.

title: Audio to Animation Toolset
description: Development of a toolset to analyze .wav audio files and create matching, believable facial animations that work with the game's current rigs.

title: AWS Batch Interface
description: A cloud based batch solution utilising Amazon Web Servers to offload much of the conversion and export work from users machines to speed up their workflows.

title: Backpacks
description: Concepting and creating generic backpacks to support physicalized inventory, as well as developing a scalable system for equipping backpacks onto a variety of armors.

title: Banu Merchantman
description: Building, balancing, and implementing the Merchantman, the Banu-made trading vessel, into the game.

title: Basilisk Advocacy Undersuit
description: Encompasses all tasks related the Advocacy undersuit made by Basilisk.

title: Behring S7 Ballistic Gatling
description: Designing and creating the Behring S7 Ballistic Gatling ship weapon. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

card.title: Behring S7 Ballistic Gatling
card.description: Creation and implementation of the new Behring S7 Ballistic Gatling ship weapon

title: Behring S7 Laser Cannon
description: Designing and creating the Behring S7 Laser Cannon ship weapon. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

card.title: Behring S7 Laser Cannon
card.description: Creation and implementation of the new Behring S7 Laser Cannon ship weapon

title: Bespoke Take & Place
description: Definable and bespoke take and place animations actions for specific items. For example, the take and place animation for a helmet should be different from a bottle or grenade.

title: Boat Movement Parameters
description: Creation and support for a new vehicle movement simulation and movement type for use with boats or other aquatic vehicles.

title: Bombs
description: These systems will allow players in certain ships to drop a variety of powerful bombs over targets in atmosphere.

card.title: Bombs
card.description: Players will have the ability to drop powerful bombs on targets from ships in atmosphere

title: Boreal Stalker
description: Implementing the boreal stalker creature into the game. Created by microTech genetic engineers to fill the apex predator niche wthin their planet's ecosystem, the boreal stalker roams its tundras searching for prey.

title: Bounty Hunter V2
description: Enabling players to track criminals via a mobiGlas security app linked to distress beacons, comm arrays, air traffic control systems, cameras, and NPC informants. This will rely on various new backend tech, including Virtual AI, the NPC Scheduler, and Security Service.

title: Breakers Yard
description: Breakers Yard is an environmental location hidden deep within Odin I.

title: Bug Fixing & Tech Debt
description: General bug-fixing and optimization for all game features and backend tech.

title: Building Blocks Shop Conversion
description: Convert the UI used when visiting item shops to work with Building Block technology and prepare the layout for the upcoming Organizational Perks.

title: Building Interiors
description: Create gameplay focused layouts to fill the interiors of the various buildings in landing zones.

title: Cargo System Refactor
description: Refactor to allow both found and purchased cargo to be picked up, moved around, and placed into the cargo grid of a ship.

title: Cave Improvements
description: Adding two new cave entrances to the PU. The 'drive-in' entrance will allow players to enter using a ground vehicle, while the 'sinkhole' entrance will require players to enter and exit using a ship.

card.title: Cave Entrances - Drive-In & Sinkhole
card.description: Adding two new entrances to planetary caves

title: Chapter 01
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 1 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 02
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 2 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 03
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 3 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 04
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 4 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 05
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 5 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 06
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 6 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 07
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 7 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 08
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 8 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 09
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 9 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 10
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 10 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 11
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 11 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 12
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 12 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 13
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 13 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 14
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 14 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 15
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 15 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 16
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 16 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 17
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 17 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 18
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 18 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 19
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 19 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 20
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 20 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 21
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 21 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 22
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 22 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 23
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 23 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 24
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 24 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 25
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 25 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 26
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 26 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Chapter 27
description: Designing, implementing, and iterating on chapter 27 of Squadron 42's single-player campaign.

title: Character Attachment Volumes
description: Volume guidelines for weapon and item attachments on characters to allow for better design implementation from the concept phase.

title: Character Creator
description: Developing the player character creator for the Squadron 42 single player campaign.

title: Character Work
description: Creation and implementation of various characters in Squadron 42's single-player campaign, including art, animation, and AI behavior.

title: Charge/Drain T0
description: All back-end tech tasks related to creating the first pass of the charge/drain power feature that will be used in future location and mission updates.

title: Checkpoint - Restore Ship State
description: Once implemented, re-loading from a checkpoint will restore the ship state when it was saved, or in a designer specified state.

title: Chemline
description: Chemline is an abandoned extraction facility built by Chemline Solutions located on Gainey in the Odin system.

title: CIG Profile Improvements
description: Ongoing improvements and optimizations to CIG Profile, giving better visualization of performance data and a better overall handle on performance costs.

title: Civilian NPC Movement Improvements
description: Various improvements to the animation and behavior of civilian NPCs to make them feel less stiff and robotic, allowing them to move in a more natural way. This will also be improving the appearance of their awareness of the surrounding environment and other NPCs in their vicinity.

title: Cloud Test Launcher V3.0
description: Add console capability to Cloud Test Launcher to allow testers to interact with large numbers of headless clients on an individual or group basis.

title: Cloud Test Launcher V4.0
description: Add support for additional test environments, Fleet API, and fine-grained user authorization.

title: Cockpit Button Animations
description: Finalize Gladius dashboard buttons with multi-states and fully demonstrable with a procedural animations for each state.

title: Comm Array Mission Improvements
description: Several mission improvements and totally new missions set across and around the Comm Arrays, with a specific focus on PvP content.

title: Comm Array Status on Backend Update
description: Communicate Comm Array/Monitored Zone status changes to backend services to enable incorporation into Quantum and Virtual AI.

title: Commodity Kiosk
description: Converting the commodity kiosks to utilize Building Blocks. This will also add loading timers, which will need to be factored-in when planning cargo runs.

title: Configuration Service
description: This service is responsible for real-time distribution of configuration to services and clients.

title: Cooperative Locomotion
description: This mechanic allows players to grab some larger objects and move them around an environment by either pushing or pulling it.

card.title: Object Push & Pull
card.description: Allow players to push and pull objects

title: Counterfeiting / Data Download Mission
description: Implementing missions that task players with infiltrating ships defended by hostile NPCs to hack terminals. There will be both lawful and unlawful variants of these missions.

title: Creature Rigging Pipeline
description: Development and creation of the internal rigging pipeline.

title: Crusader
description: All tasks relating to the creation of the planet Crusader, including points of interest. This beautiful-yet-dangerous gas giant is home to the Orison landing zone, a picturesque city floating on orbital latticework.

card.title: Planet - Crusader
card.description: The design, creation, and implementation of the Crusader gas giant

title: Crusader Ares Starfighter Inferno
description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Crusader Ares Starfighter Inferno as a flight-ready vehicle.

card.title: Crusader Ares Starfighter Inferno
card.description: Implementing the Crusader Ares Starfighter Inferno into the game

title: Crusader Ares Starfighter Ion
description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Crusader Ares Starfighter Ion as a flight-ready vehicle.

card.title: Crusader Ares Starfighter Ion
card.description: Implementing the Crusader Ares Starfighter Ion into the game

title: Crusader Genesis Starliner
description: Building, implementing, and balancing Crusader's passenger transport, the Genesis Starliner, as a flight-ready vehicle.

title: Crusader Hercules Starlifter A2
description: Encompasses all tasks, including design, art, audio, and tech, required for the implementation of the Crusader A2 Hercules gunship into the PU.

card.title: Crusader A2 Hercules Starlifter
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the Crusader A2 Hercules Starlifter gunship

title: Crusader Hercules Starlifter C2
description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Crusader Hercules Starlifter C2 as a flight-ready vehicle.

card.title: Crusader C2 Hercules Starlifter
card.description: Implementing the Crusader Hercules Starlifter C2 into the game

title: Crusader Hercules Starlifter M2
description: Encompasses all tasks, including design, art, audio, and tech, required for the implementation of the Crusader M2 Hercules military transporter into the PU.

card.title: Crusader M2 Hercules Starlifter
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the Crusader M2 Hercules Starlifter military transporter

title: Curelife Medical Tool
description: Create a Curelife-branded medical tool for use in the field and within hospitals. This will be used by medics instead of the Multi-Tool.

card.title: Curelife Medical Tool
card.description: Create and implement a medical tool.

title: Cybernetics Concept
description: Cybernetics concepts that will go towards the eventual implementation of the Death of a Spaceman gameplay.

title: Datacore Deserializer
description: A C++ Star Service that uses the normal game tech to read the DataCore data - whether that be in binary format or loose files - and exposes it via a Diffusion API.

title: DebugGUI
description: Improving existing and adding new in-engine debugging tools based on immediate mode graphical user interface to reduce the usage of on-screen text debugging.

title: Delivery Mission - Dangerous Locations
description: Implement missions tasking the player with delivering hazardous cargo to dangerous locations. Cargo will be damage-sensitive and must be protected while outlaws attempt to destroy it.

title: Delivery Mission - Timed
description: Implement timed delivery missions with multiple drops and varied timers. This will require players to prioritize drops and plan routes to ensure all packages are delivered on time. These missions will vary between local drops and long-distance deliveries.

title: Derelict Spaceships - Points of Interest
description: Points of interest that will be scattered on planets. They will be derelict spaceships with some type of activity (puzzle, traversal, hostile AI) and some type of reward for resolving said activity.

card.title: Derelict Spaceships - Points of Interest
card.description: Derelict spaceships scattered on planets

title: Derelict/Damage Pass
description: This work aims to focus on further improving derelict/damaged assets.

title: Destructible Environments
description: This feature will allow individual pieces of foliage to be destroyed, and this can also be used to populate a destruction map to record data about ecosystem destruction.

title: Destructible Workflow
description: Building out a workflow to allow artists and designers to work with destructible objects.

title: DGS Mesh Node
description: DGS Mesh Node implements multiple Dedicated Game Servers (DGS) and clients connected to the same instance of the Hybrid service, and allows DGS to exchange entities and authority over them.

title: Disarray Ammunition
description: This is a new charged ballistic projectile that emits electromagnetic pulses, helping to not only damage the target but also to disrupt power systems.

title: DNA Toolbox Updates
description: Updates to our DNA toolbox to improve the DNA markup workflow for designers and artists alike.

title: Docking - Ship to Ship
description: All tasks related to the feature that allow smaller ships to dock in larger ships while in space.

title: Docking - Ship to Station
description: Adding the ability to dock ships with space stations and other ships. This also includes spawning docked ships at space stations and within larger vessels.

card.title: Ship to Station Docking
card.description: Implementing the ability to dock ships to space stations

title: Drake Corsair
description: Building, balancing, and implementing Drake Interplanetary's multi-crew explorer, the Corsair, into the game.

title: Drake Vulture
description: Building, balancing, and implementing Drake Interplanetary's light salvage ship, the Vulture, into the game.

card.title: Drake Vulture
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the Drake Vulture salvage ship.

title: Dynamic Environment
description: Updating the Emergency Outposts as a proof-of-concept for the new dynamic interior environments. This includes allowing players to use the Multi-Tool Tractor Beam thanks to the addition of interactable props and consumables.

title: Dynamic Events
description: Continued work on backend tech to support the development of Dynamic Events in Star Citizen's ever expanding universe.

title: Dynamic Objects Presets
description: Dynamic object presets will allow our scattered object presets to adjust to external factors such as weather, proximity to rivers/coasts, and differing climates.

title: Dynamic Population
description: All milestones that need to be passed in order to implement dynamic populations in various locations around the ‘verse.

title: Ecosystem Enhancements
description: Enhancing the realism of plants and animals in their aspects and behaviors, to better immerse them in their respective environments.

title: ECUS Improvements
description: The Entity Component Update Scheduler, or ECUS, is the central manager responsible for maintaining all component updates and Events. Over the last months, several improvements where done on that system, bringing it into the main development stream.

title: Enemy Characters
description: Encompasses all tasks related to an enemy faction's characters in Squadron 42.

title: Enemy Ships
description: Construction and implementation of approved concepts for various enemy ships.

title: Entity Graph API
description: Engine implementation for Entity Graph database access.

title: Entity Graph Seeding
description: This will allow EntityGraph to be "seeded" with the initial "factory state" of all the entities in a Shard.

title: Entity Graph Single-Player Implementation
description: In-memory single-player entity graph database for Squadron 42 and single-player Arena Commander game modes.

title: Entity Stow/Destroy
description: "Stow" refers to moving an item into an inventory. For example, a ship loaded with cargo being stowed, stores the ship and it's associated cargo. This work implements removing items from the Replication Layer, moving its persistent data into an inventory managed by the EntityGraph.

title: EntityArea Improvements
description: Provide more developer flexibility for placing object pivot points, change the shape format from custom to common, and to support the same kind of complex shapes we aim to with VisAreas, we will need segments on Entity Areas as well.

title: EntityAreas - Entity Area Animation
description: As we unify the different shape systems, we need to reach feature parity. To achieve this, we need to support animations on Entity Areas.

title: Error Reporting & Crash Handling
description: Unify and normalize crash handling across environments for clients, game server instances and services, to provide faster correlation of client crashes to backend and simulation crashes.

title: EVA T2
description: Further improves the EVA experience following the transition to IFCS. Introduces limited EVA fuel and encourages the use of zero-G push/pull and the Multi-Tool's tractor beam.

card.title: Actor Feature - EVA T2
card.description: Further improves the EVA experience following the transition to IFCS

title: Event System - One Shot Triggers
description: When complete, the Event System will no longer have multiple loops when events are dispatched.

title: Feature Testing Framework
description: Improve the structure for automated testing to allow different teams to more efficiently create and managed tests for their own features.

title: Female Player Head
description: Completing a modeling and texture polish for the female player's head. After this pass on this asset, it will be sent to Tech Animation for a rigging update.

title: Fire Extinguisher
description: All tasks required to implement functioning fire extinguishers in-game. This feature will work alongside the fire hazard system.

title: Fire Hazard
description: The Fire Hazard system will track fire & temperature on static and dynamic objects. For the initial release of fire, the feature will be setup on a select few vehicles.

title: Force Reactions
description: Expanding on the physics based reactions to physical forces. Actors are made to stagger and collide with their environment and experience inertia, regardless of being the pilot.

card.title: Force Reactions
card.description: Actors react to direct, indirect & sustained forces

title: FPS Devices - Deployables
description: While throwable and consumable devices already exist within Star Citizen as grenades and MedPens, further work on this system will enable us to more easily create new items with different effects when used. This includes the development of deployable devices, items that can be carried around as part of a player loadout, equipped and deployed onto a surface.

title: FPS Radar / Scanning
description: Improved signature system, supporting much greater distances, and dampening of signatures by environmental interference and larger signatures. Improved Scanning, driven by the same signature system as the Radar and Ping, available in Ships, ground vehicles, and FPS

card.title: FPS Radar & Scanning
card.description: Implementing radar and scanning for players on foot

title: FPS: Realistic Weapon Handling
description: Adding functionality for AI to evaluate their proficiency with different weapons, use the one best suited to the situation, and manage ammunition accordingly.

title: Free Form Variable API
description: Blackboard service for gamecode systems to write generic persistent variables.

title: Frontier Clothing
description: Generating concepts for frontier-style clothing for players and NPCs.

title: FS-Tech-Anim - Asset Integration
description: Game dev integration of .skin and .dna files with addition of LOD optimization and fixes.

title: Gainey
description: Odin I's former moon, known as Gainey, still drifts near the remnants of the planet.

title: Gameplay Stats Service
description: This service is responsible for collecting, persisting, and querying player gameplay statistics.

title: Gatac Railen
description: Building, implementing, and balancing Gatac's cargo hauler, the Railen, as a flight-ready vehicle.

title: Gen12 - Renderer T1
description: Generation 12 Rendering will replace the current DX11 renderer with a new rendering system.

title: Generic Ship Screens - UI
description: Generic UI screens that can be used in all future ships.

title: Generic Utility Backpack
description: Creating material variants of the existing utility backpack to act as a generic backpack for existing utility armors in the PU.

title: Greycat Industrial Cutter Tool
description: Designing and creating the new stand-alone dedicated cutting tool. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

title: Greycat Industrial MT FPS Attachments
description: Designing and creating the GRIN Multi-tool FPS Attachments. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

title: Greycat Industrial ROC-DS
description: Building, implementing, and balancing the Greycat ROC-DS as a drivable vehicle.

card.title: Greycat ROC-DS
card.description: Implementing the Greycat ROC-DS into the game

title: Greycat Industrial Salvage Backpack
description: Concepting, designing, and implementing this variant of the Greycat Specialist Backpack, geared toward storing salvaged material.

title: Greycat Industrial Salvage Tool
description: Designing and creating a stand-alone salvage tool. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

title: Greycat Industrial Tractor Tool
description: Designing and creating the dedicated tractor beam tool. This includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

title: Greycat PTV Gold Standard
description: Implementing, polishing, and optimizing all features required to bring the Greycat PTV to gold standard.

title: GrimHex - Hospital Interior Location
description: Implementation of a working clinic located within GrimHex, where players can be healed, as well as purchase medical supplies and life insurance.

card.title: GrimHex Clinic
card.description: Clinic interior located in the GrimHex landing zone

title: Ground Scramble Race
description: Adding Scramble Races to Hurston and its moons along with general improvements and bug fixes.

title: Hacking T0
description: All back-end tech tasks related to creating the first pass of the hacking feature that will be used in future location and mission updates. When implemented in-game this feature will be used to access systems and areas that have been previously closed to the player. The hacking process will be represented via a minigame that is displayed on the player's HUD visor.

card.title: Hacking - Tech
card.description: Creating the back end tech required for Hacking

title: Hangar Manager App V1
description: Creating a mobiGlas app that emulates the functionality of ASOP terminals, allowing players to spawn ships, claim insurance and access the array of landing services to maintain their ships.

card.title: Hangar Manager App
card.description: New mobiGlas app that emulates the functionality of ASOP terminals

title: Harvestables/Minables
description: Adding the first iteration of 'looting'. This involves spawning weapons, bottles of water, MedPens, and clothing at various locations that the player can find, store, and use.

title: Head Rigging
description: Creation of additional animation rigs to be used by various character heads.

title: Healing T0 / Actor Status T1
description: The improved Player Status System focuses on implementing additional statuses, specifically intoxication and effects from drugs, and the associated functional and visual feedback. This also will allow players to use items with healing properties, such as the MedPen, on other player characters and NPCs.

card.title: Tech - Healing T0
card.description: Creating the back-end technology required for Healing T0

title: Heat Suit
description: This is a heavy armor suit (manufactured by Caldera) that is meant to hold up to extreme heat conditions found on various planets.

title: HEX
description: Increase Hex Tools feature set to enable player relations and developers to view and manipulate real-time data from all microservices in the mesh.

title: Hospital Doctor Uniform
description: Doctor uniform worn by NPCs working in hospitals.

title: Hospital Medical Concept Kit
description: Concepts for a variety of hospital themed NPCs, planned alongside the release of Hospitals as a Landing Zone element.

title: Hospital Nurse
description: Nurse uniform worn by NPCs working in hospitals.

title: Hospitals T0
description: Encompasses all tasks, including design, art, audio, and tech required for the implementation of the first hospitals in the persistent universe.

title: Hull Visual Degradation
description: Introducing visual wear-and-tear to player ships as they age and degrade. When implemented, ships will subtly change depending on how long they have existed in the 'verse.

card.title: Vehicle Visual Degradation
card.description: Introducing visual wear-and-tear to player ships as they age and degrade

title: Hybrid Service
description: Moves the network code's Replication Layer out of the Dedicated Game Server (DGS) and into a stand-alone service. This service is referred to as the Hybrid, as later versions of Server Meshing will split it into component services handling different aspects of the Replication Layer's functionality. The first version of Server Meshing will use the Hybrid service to manage client and server streaming, replication of networked state between clients and servers, and persisting state changes to the EntityGraph.

title: Identity Service
description: Identity service will be a proxy service that will relay information about accounts between the RSI platform, Tavern (Spectrum) and the game client.

title: Improved OC Workflow
description: Quality of life and workflow improvements to Object Container handling within the Editor.

title: Incendiary Ammunition
description: This is a new ballistic projectile that burns on impact, causing the target to take damage over time and potentially causing items in the environment to catch fire.

title: Increasing Player Hab Number
description: Increase of Player Habs to 100 per landing zone.

title: Infiltrate/Defend Mission
description: Underground Facilities are the first place to benefit from the addition of spawn closets which allow us the expansion of the suite of missions that take place there. Missions range from all-out assaults to situations where you may be able to complete objectives without the need to engage in combat at all, and include both lawful and unlawful versions.

card.title: Infiltrate and Defend Missions
card.description: Infiltrate and Defend missions using existing locations

title: Inventory System
description: Creating an updated API system that supports multiple player/location inventories, stacking as well as trading between inventories.

title: Inventory Unstow
description: "Unstow" refers to fetching an item from an inventory and placing it into a Shard. For example, a ship loaded with cargo being unstowed, removes the ship and it's associated cargo from the inventory and places them into the game. This work implements moving an item's persistent data from an inventory into a Shard managed by the EntityGraph, and adding the item to the Replication Layer.

title: Itemport Mod API
description: This API allows tools like the Vehicle Modification App (VMA) to modify ship loadouts inside inventories.

title: Jira Archiver
description: Create a tool that archives old Jira tickets to help manage completed, outdated and deprecated tasks.

title: Jump Module
description: Encompasses the initial steps to determine the look and variety of jump modules.

title: Jump Point Spacescaping
description: Creating the environments around the Jump Points connecting Stanton and Pyro. The locations will utilize gas cloud tech and include rest stops and other infrastructure.

title: Jump Points
description: Building out the functionality, visual, and audio effects for the jump points used to travel between systems, and setting them up in-game. Including necessary vehicle items and functionality, the jump points themselves, and their inner tunnels.

title: Klaus & Werner Attachments
description: Designing and creating the new Klaus & Werner weapon attachments. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

title: Landing Gear Springs
description: Support for Cinematics to be able to control landing gear spring height.

title: Laser Trip Mine
description: Implementing laser trip mines into the game, which are explosives that use light beams as triggers. When someone or something comes into contact with the beam, the mine goes boom.

title: Lava Tech
description: Modifying and tuning river tech to produce impressive lava rivers and lakes.

title: Law System Improvements
description: Updates to the Law System include proxy crime when one person on board a ship commits a felony and the option to hide notifications and criminal rating updates.

title: Lean Over Cover
description: Implementing the tech and animation needed to allow characters and NPCs to push into cover objects, as well as look, lean, and shoot over them.

title: Levski - Hospital Interior Location
description: Levski hospital interior where players can heal, revive, and purchase medical supplies and life insurance.

title: Levski Hospital Staff Outfits
description: Implementing variant outfits and loadouts for the staff of Levski hospitals.

title: Life Support T0
description: Implementing the first iteration of onboard life support systems in ships, which entails a ship component that generates air when turned on, and management of said life support component within the vehicle loadout manager.

title: Login Flow
description: Improving the login process to allow for more stability and easier analysis of errors, as well as improvements to queue that will help streamline the login process, particularly in instances of high concurrency.

title: Long Distance Probing
description: This feature will allow players to launch quantum-traveling probes that can detect signatures at extreme ranges far beyond the reach of ship scanners. The signatures can ultimately be used to identify point-of-interest and plan quantum travel.

title: Loot Generation T0
description: Implementing the systems that generate containers throughout the persistent universe (crates/lockers/boxes) that contain dynamically populated, randomized loot.

card.title: Loot Generation T0
card.description: Implementing the system responsible for the generation of lootable containers throughout the world

title: Loot Generation T1
description: This system deals with the generation of lootable containers throughout the world, their contents and how they can be accessed/broken in to.

title: Lorville - Hospital Interior Location
description: Implementation of a working hospital located in Lorville, where players can be healed and revived, as well as purchase medical supplies and life insurance.

card.title: Lorville Hospital: Maria Pure of Heart
card.description: Hospital interior located in the Lorville landing zone

title: Lorville Hospital Staff Outfits
description: Implementing variant outfits and loadouts for the staff of Lorville hospitals.

title: Mag Stripping/Refill
description: This will allow players to strip found weapons of their ammunition. They can then remove each bullet and refill their own magazines manually or via a bullet reloader. This is only compatible with ballistic ammunition.

title: Male Specialist Heavy RRS Armor
description: Creating an RRS Specialist heavy armor set, including its material variants.

title: Male Specialist Light RRS Armor
description: A modular light armor set aimed for stealth specialization.

title: Map and Radar System Rework
description: An overhaul of the underlying system and associated UI for the Starmap, radar, local area map, and minimap.

title: Maya Live Link
description: Maya Live Link establishes a link between Maya and the engine's Sandbox Editor. It is primarily meant to give animators the best possible, "what you see is what you get" style preview quality by seamlessly integrating the Editor-rendered images in the Maya viewport.

title: Maya Loadouts from P4K
description: Encompasses tasks related to querying skin files and geometry from P4K and rebuild them inside maya on an existing maya animation rig.

title: Medical Gown
description: When players respawn in hospitals, they will respawn wearing a medical gown to show that they have been treated at the hospital.

title: Medical UI Support
description: Creating specific shaders to allow for medical gameplay UI, such as skeleton and X-Ray shaders.

title: MFD Rework
description: We will both rebuild ship MFDs with our new Building Blocks UI technology, as well as completely redesign them in an effort to make them more customizable, better matched to ship aesthetics, and better at serving ship gameplay.

title: Migrating Legacy Vehicle XMLs to Datacore
description: Updating XML vehicle data to be stored in a new optimized location and format.

title: Mining Components
description: Mining sub-components will allow players to customize their lasers to suit specific jobs and encounters. For example, some will make mining easier, some will make it faster, and some will have great stat boosts at the cost of serious trade-offs elsewhere.

card.title: Mining Sub-Components
card.description: Implementation of mining laser sub-components

title: Mining Gadgets
description: Mining Gadgets will help to modify the rock and assist the player with mining a Deposit. The player can attach a device physically to a mineable deposit in FPS to modify its stats, making mining either easier and safer, or quicker and riskier.

card.title: Mining Gadgets
card.description: Implementing new gadgets that can be placed on a ship-mineable rock that makes the rock easier to mine.

title: MISC Hull A
description: Encompasses all tasks, including design, art, audio, and tech required for the implementation of the MISC Hull-A cargo hauler in the PU.

card.title: MISC Hull A
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the MISC Hull A cargo hauler

title: MISC Hull C
description: Encompasses all tasks, including design, art, audio, and tech, required for the implementation of the MISC Hull-C heavy cargo hauler into the PU.

card.title: MISC Hull C
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the Hull-C heavy cargo hauler

title: MISC Hull D
description: Building, implementing, and balancing MISC's heavy cargo hauler, the Hull D, as a flight-ready vehicle.

title: MISC Hull E
description: Building, implementing, and balancing MISC's heavy cargo hauler, the Hull E, as a flight-ready vehicle.

title: Miscellaneous Support
description: Includes general support for other teams, updating existing features, or small tasks that don't necessitate a full entry.

title: Missile Operator Mode
description: Missiles will now be controlled under a dedicated missile operator mode, which gives players the option to select and fire specific missiles while operating in ships, such as the Vanguard, which allow for different types of missiles and torpedoes.

card.title: Missile Operator Mode
card.description: Giving players the ability to select and fire specific missiles

title: Missiles Improvements
description: Convert missiles to use the IFCS guidance and control systems. This will improve missile performance and tracking ability, enabling greater control over general missile behaviors.

card.title: Missiles - Guidance & Control Rework
card.description: Convert missiles to use the IFCS guidance and control systems

title: Mission Manager App
description: Alongside converting to Building Blocks, this feature includes an updated UI in support of the dynamic mission system. Also includes the ability for players to see the reputational requirements of mission content.

title: Mission Manager Updates
description: Alongside converting to Building Blocks, this feature includes an updated UI in support of the dynamic mission system. Also includes the ability for players to see the reputational requirements of mission content.

title: MOAB
description: Designing and creating the 'Mother of all bombs' or MOAB. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

card.title: Bombs
card.description: Players will have the ability to drop powerful bombs on targets from ships in atmosphere

title: Mop & Bucket
description: Enabling support for AI janitors to use multiple tools in either hand.

title: Mounted Guns
description: Further expanding the player's arsenal by allowing them to take control of a mounted gun on either a vehicle or the ground. These weapons will offer greater firepower and stability at the cost of mobility.

card.title: Mounted Guns
card.description: Ability to use mounted guns on vehicles

title: Move Planet to Compute
description: Planetary terrain chunks have an important screen rendering fill-rate. Distant terrain shading attributes are computed on a per pixel basis which is not necessary most of of the time. By using a compute shader we can simplify and reduce the pixel shader cost to boost the overall terrain rendering performance.

title: MT Healing Attachment
description: Designing and creating the multi-tool healing attachment. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

card.title: Greycat Multi-tool Healing Attachment
card.description: Creation and implementation of the new multi-tool healing attachment

title: MT Salvage Attachment
description: Designing and creating the multi-tool salvage attachment. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

card.title: Greycat Multi-tool Salvage Attachment
card.description: Creation and implementation of the new multi-tool salvage attachment

title: MultiGrid SDF - Capital Ship Destruction
description: Enabling the interior of a ship to follow the exterior, allowing capital ships to split in two.

title: Name Resolving API
description: Engine implementation for entity class name resolving service.

title: Navy Jumpsuit
description: A generic navy jumpsuit worn by various NPCs that will be encountered throughout Squadron 42.

title: New Babbage - Hospital Interior Location
description: New Babbage hospital interior where players can heal, revive, and purchase medical supplies and life insurance.

card.title: New Babbage Hospital
card.description: Hospital interior located in the New Babbage landing zone

title: New Building Blocks Editor
description: A new editor for building blocks to increase productivity for UI artists and designers. It will include various tools to make visual layouts, animation, and restyling easier.

title: NPC Character Creation Service
description: This service will aid in the creation of AI at specific locations for specific reasons, such as the Quantum Simulation.

title: NPC Scheduler Service
description: The NPC Scheduler is meant to add and remove NPC's to the game, dynamically spawning them into and out of the 'verse based on NPC Archetype, Maximum number of NPC's in a given area, and the probabilities of those NPC Archetypes.

title: NPC Tracker Service
description: The NPC Tracker Service tracks and records the actions of players and NPCs. In turn, Bounty Hunting gameplay will use this service to expose the actions taken by outlaws so they can be tracked by Bounty Hunters.

title: Nyx System, Planet, and Mission Setup
description: Completing the initial foundational work needed to implement the Nyx System into the game.

title: Origin 400i
description: Building, balancing, and implementing Origin's luxury explorer, the 400i, into the game.

card.title: Origin 400i
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the Origin 400i explorer.

title: Origin 600i Gold Standard
description: Implementing, polishing, and optimizing all features required to bring the Origin 600i to gold standard.

title: Origin M50 Engine Swap
description: Update to allow players to swap the bespoke engine of the Origin M50 for other compatible components.

title: Origin X1
description: Building, implementing, and balancing Origin's hover bike, the X1, as a flight-ready vehicle.

title: Orison - Hospital Interior Location
description: Orison hospital interior where players can heal, revive, and purchase medical supplies and life insurance.

card.title: Orison Hospital
card.description: Hospital interior located in the Orison landing zone

title: Orison Executive Outfit
description: This is a set of clothing intended to represent some of the higher end occupants of Crusader. They will be worn by people on Crusader such as the managers and higher level directors of the business.

title: Orison Jacket
description: Building and implementing Orison themed jackets that can be worn by NPCs and also be purchased by players.

title: Orison Mascot Suit
description: A mascot outfit worn by NPCs to showcase Orison's whale mascot that will welcome players to Orison.

title: Orison Outfit 01
description: Building and implementing a series of Orison uniforms worn by NPCs that can also be purchased by players.

title: Orison V1
description: Comprised of a latticework of platforms suspended in mid-atmosphere, Orison is considered one of the most picturesque locations in Stanton. This task includes creating all areas of the landing zone, including shipyards, habs, gardens, and spaceport.

card.title: Orison Landing Zone
card.description: All tasks required to add Crusader’s landing zone into the game

title: Orison V2
description: Improving Crusader's landing zone with more shops and expanding various services around the city.

card.title: Orison v2
card.description: Adding more shops and services to the Orison landing zone

title: Outer System
description: Polish pass on existing environmental assets around the outer system.

title: Outlaw Medical Outfits
description: Design and implementation of a surgical apron for outlaw medics.

title: Outpost Homestead - Independent & Outlaw
description: A small home for AI to live and shelter. They consist of a central hub and a few optional internal and external modules. They provide the basic necessities to support a small group of people for an indefinite amount of time.

title: Outpost Theme Variants
description: Adding themed variants to Colonialism outposts, which allows us to create different points of interest in the world. Themes will range from abandoned, mining, research, and many more.

title: Persistent Habs
description: Work that grants players the ability to have their own Persistent Habs.

title: Persistent Hangars
description: Work that grants players the ability to have their own Persistent Hangars. This will also bring changes to the Cargo gameplay loop by allowing players to pack their grids manually.

card.title: Persistent Hangars
card.description: Ability to have persistent hangars at your starting location, and temporary hangars in locations you're visiting

title: Persistent Streaming and Server Meshing
description: Proprietary Server Meshing and Persistence Technology will allow Star Citizen to scale up it's shared universe across game servers. Eventually this technology will allow thousands of players to co-exist in the verse. Once the first version of this is implemented the number of servers and players will increase over successive versions.

title: Personal Inventory
description: When implemented, players will physically store weapons, gadgets, consumables, healing items, and more on their person and in vehicles via backpacks, pockets, and containers. This utilizes the new iCache for persistence wherever players travel.

card.title: Actor Feature - Personal Inventory
card.description: Implements the Personal Inventory for all usable and storable items.

title: Physical Damage & Breakability
description: Making use of the physics engine to create a system that looks and behaves realistically when large objects such as ships are damaged by weaponry or colliding with other ships, locations, or planets.

title: Physical QT Movement
description: Perform the QT movement within physics, along with efficient empty space checks along the QT path to determine when to drop out of QT if a potential intersection might occur.

title: Physical/Local Inventory Support
description: Adjusting shops and VMA to support the required API changes for local/physical inventory for players. Some of the transaction code will also be refactored, and several additional debugging options are being added so that we can identify problems and resolve bugs faster. The VMA will be updated so a player can only adjust their ship's loadout if they are in a location where they are currently storing other ship related items.

card.title: Physical/Local Inventory Support
card.description: Adjusting shops and VMA to support the required API changes for local/physical inventory

title: PlanEd & SolEd Support
description: Continuous support for workflow improvements and implementing features based on core planet tech changes, including bug fixes for both the Planet Editor and Solar System Editor.

title: Planet GPU displacement
description: Offload CPU computation by applying displacement terrain offset in GPU for distant terrain chunks in the tessellation stage. This aims to provide a better terrain chunk LODs stability and a softer visual transition between terrain and ocean.

title: Plasma Ammunition
description: Further work on this damage type will cause damage over time to actors, vehicles and ships. Larger weapons of this type will also leave behind a hazard, causing further damage to anything in close proximity to it. This will fulfill the original vision we had for the plasma weapons we already have in-game, and those we have planned for the future.

title: Player Account Entitlement
description: Incorporation of Player Account ship and item entitlement into the graph inventory database.

title: Player Body
description: Increasing the poly count of the player's body for close up scenes involving hands and feet.

title: Player Interaction Experience T0 - Hints & Interactions
description: The Player Interaction Experience (PIE) is a holistic array of complimentary features and systems, all related directly to the player. Player status, item status, environment status, as well as interactions with both the game world and the objects within it, are covered under these systems.

card.title: Player Interaction Experience
card.description: The Player Interaction Experience (PIE) represents complimentary features and systems related to the player

title: Player Interaction Experience T1 - Lockers & Inventory
description: Lockers T1 introduces a consistent way to store clothes, armor, and items in a physicalized state. Also includes a more robust and tactile method of storing items on shelves and attachment surfaces. This builds on the Personal Inventory, expanding the inventory UI to include lockers.

title: Player Interaction Experience T2 - Visor HUD & Helmet
description: Builds on the existing heads-up display (HUD) with a new look and feel. Includes a new equip and remove experience, boot-up and power-down sequences, and transitions between FPS and ship HUDs.

title: Player Item Shard Transition
description: With the introduction of fully persistent shards, items/ships that are left “in the open space” are bound to that shard until a player collects them and stores them into an inventory or parks a ship at a landing location. In order to provide a more frictionless experience we will implement a feature that automatically stores these ‘freely placed’ items from the shard when areas are streamed out, and places them into a different shard when the player logs into a new shard. This allows players to find their freely placed ships/items that are left in the open space regardless of which shard instance they are assigned during login.

title: Player Reflection
description: This feature assures the player will see a believable representation of their character when looking into a mirror or other reflective surface in first person view.

title: Port Over Remaining Mesh Rendering
description: Porting all mesh-based rendering operation to Gen12.

title: Probability Volume Encounter Density Refactor
description: Probability volumes are currently hard-coded and static. This refactor will allow for us to have much more control of how probability volumes are created from the backend so that we can dynamically change the feel of the game through other services, like Quantum.

title: Profile Guided Optimizations
description: Writing code is hard, writing high performance code is harder. And sometimes problematic code slips in. We want to focus on some of those instances, by profiling and attacking the top offenders.

title: Proximity Mine
description: Implementing proximity mines into the game, which are explosives that have a defined area trigger zone. When someone or something enters that zone, the trigger is tripped and the mine explodes.

title: Pyro Space Stations
description: Adding small rundown Rest Stop stations to the Pyro system, which provide basic services and use limited interiors.

title: Pyro Spacescaping
description: Utilizing gas cloud tech, VDB elements will be crafted to spacescape the Pyro System.

title: Pyro System, Planet, and Mission Setup
description: Completing the initial foundational work needed to implement the Pyro System into the game.

title: Quantum Simulation
description: Revealed at CitizenCon 2019, the Quantum Simulation will serve as the background economy for Star Citizen. Thousands of unseen simulated entities will carry out trade, commerce, piracy, and security to populate and inform other game systems.

title: Quantum Travel Experience
description: Updating Quantum Travel mechanic to move players in a more physically realistic way, and improve the general QT experience, adjusting how spooling/calibrating, interdictions and entering/exiting work.

title: Radar, Scanning, and Ping
description: Radar is used to passively locate and track contacts, and display their whereabouts to the player. Scanning is used to obtain information about a specific entity. Ping actively finds additional contacts, or highlights volumes of space to investigate weak signatures, both of which are displayed via the radar and its AR HUD elements.

card.title: Radar, Scanning, and Ping
card.description: Implementing Radar, Scanning, and Ping

title: RaStar
description: Developing and implementing RaStar, a tool that allows the placement of modular structures on planet surfaces, including the deformation of the surrounding terrain to accommodate it. This will eventually be used by players to place their own structures, such as with the Consolidated Outland Pioneer.

title: Recipe TDD
description: Performing an overall polish pass on the economic systems, from commodity trading to item prices to provide a better overall experience for players.

title: Refinery Overlays
description: Introducing new non-commercial overlays to the entry areas of refinery stations to add more variety and better suit the theme.

card.title: Refinery Stations - Non-Commercial Overlays
card.description: Adding non-commercial entrances to refinery stations

title: Refinery Ships
description: Certain ships will have refineries built into them, allowing players to process ore using a completely on-board process.

title: Replicated Entity Spawn Params From Network
description: Entity spawn parameters are a data record describing how to spawn a given entity. Previously these would be obtained from game code on the server and sent via the network to spawn entities on clients. This work pushes the necessary data into the network code's Replication Layer so it can create entity spawn parameters independently of other systems.

title: Replication Layer Entity Authority
description: Moves the code that handles assigning and enforcing entity authority into the Replication Layer.

title: Reputation Gates for Missions
description: Doing a more in depth pass on gating access to missions based off of the players reputation with corporations and mission givers.

title: Reputation UI
description: This feature will give players insight into their reputation with the important NPCs and organizations they have interacted with. This will also include a total list of reputation ranks, including those that have been completed and the ones they're actively working on.

card.title: UI - Reputation
card.description: Integrating data related to a player's reputation with NPCs and organizations into the UI.

title: Reputation V1 - Repuation and Org Service
description: This system will introduce the first iteration of persistent reputation between all entities within the Star Citizen universe, as well as persistent NPC organizations.

title: Rescue/Transport Mission
description: Taking advantage of AI follow behaviors to create missions where players transport customers from one location to another, along with prototype missions where player must rescue imperiled clients from dangerous situations and escort them to safety.

title: Resource Management
description: This system will handle resources for stations, settlements, cities, and all other locations. It will also unlock Engineering Station gameplay for ships, letting players manage power, CPU, fuel, shields, coolant, etc.

title: Restricted Areas 3.0
description: This includes the various tasks involved in the redesign of restricted areas. When completed, these areas will be less intrusive, making landing in cities a more seamless experience.

title: Reststop Hangar Replacements
description: Creating exterior pieces for small and medium Hangars that allow them to look and function properly as part of overall space station exteriors.

title: Retaliator Room OC Swapping
description: System support enabling players to swap vehicle rooms and modules via VMA (and allows designers to specify vehicle setup at run time in SQ42).

title: Reward Service
description: Developing and implementing back-end systems capable of tracking stats and data per player, and awarding in-game rewards to them, as well as collecting, persisting and querying those player rewards

title: Rivers and Basins
description: This tool allows rivers and basins to be further developed and readied for production use, in order to enhance the ecosystems of our planets.

title: Roads
description: Adapting existing terrain deformation and river tech to create road tooling and visuals, allowing designers to add roads into game environments.

title: RSI Bengal
description: The Bengal is a fleet carrier spacecraft developed by Roberts Space Industries (RSI) for the United Empire of Earth Navy (UEEN).

title: RSI Constellation Taurus
description: Implementing and balancing RSI's hauling variant of the Constellation, the Taurus, as a flight ready ship in the game.

card.title: RSI Constellation Taurus
card.description: Implementing the revised model of the Constellation Taurus into the game

title: RSI Lynx
description: Building, implementing, and balancing RSI's planetary rover, the Lynx, as a game-ready vehicle.

title: RSI Orion
description: Building, implementing, and balancing RSI's mining platform, the Orion, as a flight-ready vehicle.

title: RSI Scorpius
description: Building, implementing, and balancing RSI's heavy fighter, the Scorpius, as a flight-ready vehicle.

card.title: RSI Scorpius
card.description: All tasks required for the implementation of the Scorpius heavy fighter.

title: Salvage T0
description: All back-end tech tasks related to creating the first pass of the salvage feature that will be used in future location and mission updates.

title: Save/Load
description: This feature will handle the creation of the save system across Squadron 42, including player data, checkpoints, and UI. Part of this system will also store and load dynamic entities, NPC positions, and data associated with object containers.

title: SDF Shields
description: Adapt shields code to determine shield hits based off of dynamically contoured shield meshes for more accurate combat gameplay, and to eliminate possible weak spots in shields. This also extends shield tech to entities beyond just vehicles.

title: Security Behavior
description: Encompasses all tasks for NPC Security Officer behavior in the persistent universe and Squadron 42.

title: Security Network V0
description: Initial implementation of the security system. This allows security features to know if players are trespassing without having to assign them a criminal rating. Also routes criminal sightings to the backend communications network.

title: Security Network V1
description: Full implementation of the security system. Includes other features for which players may need a clearance level, such as doors and elevators.

title: Selling
description: This feature deals with the ability to sell items back to the shops. Players will have the ability to sell items from their local inventory to the shop using our Building Blocks Tech. This will also support a generalized loot system that will fill lockers and enemy's backpacks with a random assortment of items that can be looted and then taken back to shops to sell for money.

card.title: Selling Items To Shops
card.description: Adding the "Sell" screen to item kiosks and converting them to Building Blocks Tech

title: Services Distributed Load Testing System
description: Development of a distributed load testing tool that can simulate service loads and replicate user behaviours.

title: Shard Data Query API
description: This API allows gamecode access to common queries against entity graph data.

title: Shard Manager
description: Add functionality to the Hybrid for what will become the Shard Manager component service. The Shard Manager functionality is responsible for creating a shard in the EntityGraph database, ensuring it is "seeded" with an initial population of entities, communicating with matchmaking so that players can join a shard, and talking to provisioning services so that a Hybrid and Dedicated Game Servers (DGS) can be assigned to a shard.

title: Shard Replication Layer Population
description: Each Shard contains a complete independent copy of the game universe and its entity hierarchy. EntityGraph is the database providing persistent cloud storage for entities in the Shards and inventories. This work populates the Replication Layer for a Shard's server from the EntityGraph and allows changes to the persistent state to be written back.

title: Sharp Angular Asteroid Pack
description: All tasks involved in creating and implementing sharp, angular asteroid packs for use in the Pyro system.

card.title: New Asteroids - Stanton System
card.description: Adding additional asteroid variations to the Stanton System

title: Shield Capacitors V1
description: When complete, players will have the ability to manage the amount of extra energy distributed to shields, allowing them to choose between maximizing defenses or using that power to attack or escape.

card.title: Power Management v2
card.description: Integration of the capacitor system and rebalance of all connected systems to accommodate

title: Shield Emitters
description: Converting ship shield-emitters into physical objects that can be targeted and destroyed, giving players the ability to permanently disable enemy shields.

title: Ship AI - Subcomponent Targeting
description:
AI pilots will now be aware of Sub-Components of enemy ships during combat. Depending on their behavior and skill level, they will target these components to give themselves an advantage.

The scale of the opposing ships will also dictate sub-component targeting. For example, a Fighter Pilot would primarily engage and destroy the Turrets of larger ships.

title: Ship CPU
description: Designing and implementing computer blades for ships. Includes various blades that can be used to modify or improve certain aspects of a ship's functionality, such as unlocking more complex targeting abilities.

title: Ship to Ship Refueling
description: Implementing the systems that will allow players flying specific ships to refuel other ship and get paid for it. The player can fill those specific ships' fuel tanks from a station using an updated Rearm, Restock, Refuel interface at Landing Zones and Space Stations.

card.title: Ship to Ship Refueling
card.description: Implementing refueling capability to specifically equipped ships

title: Shops and Patrons
description: Vastly expand the interactive usables needed for an assortment of shops and patrons. We will be populating dozens of shops with the ‘vendor’ behavior previously seen in the bartender. This will include the Coffee Stand, Pizza bar, Kiosks, and more

card.title: Shops and Patrons
card.description: Add the ‘vendor’ behavior to the Coffee Stand, Pizza bar, Kiosks, and more

title: SolEd SDF Editor
description: Improve and expand how Asteroid Field Entities are set up on a system scale, including editor support for setting up the Asteroid Field SDF (Signed Distance Field) inside the Solar System Editor.

title: Space Mines
description: In space, players in certain ships will gain the ability to release different types of space mines in a coordinated fashion, in an attempt to trap, damage and capture enemies, or set up defensive perimeters.

title: Space Stations - Hospital Interior Location
description: Implementation of working Clinics throughout the ‘verse, where players can be healed, as well as purchase medical supplies and life insurance.

card.title: Rest Stops: Space Station Clinics
card.description: Clinic interior located in the various rest stops

title: Space Whale V1
description: The Space Whale is a creature from the gaseous planet Crusader. The Space Whale serves as a mascot for the planet and is depicted frequently in scenery around the planet and landing zone.

title: Spacescaping
description: Utilizing gas cloud tech, VDB elements will be crafted to spacescape the environments of Squadron 42.

title: Spawn Closets
description: The initial implementation of 'spawn closets'. These areas allow entities, such as NPCs, to spawn in areas outside of player view. These will be used to support missions, location populations, and security responses.

card.title: Missions - Spawn Closets
card.description: The initial implementation of ‘spawn closets’

title: Spectrum Party Sync
description: Creating the ability to create a new party or view your current party in Spectrum.

title: SQ42 - Vehicle Support
description: Polishing and iterating on various vehicles needed for the Squadron 42 single-player campaign.

title: Stair Locomotion T1
description: This includes new animations depending on whether the character is walking, running, or sprinting and procedural foot alignment to ensure the character hits each stair correctly.

title: Stanton Asteroids
description: Creating replacements for the asteroids currently used in the Stanton system using the new organic asset workflow.

card.title: New Asteroids - Stanton System
card.description: Adding additional asteroid variations to the Stanton System

title: Stanton System Polish v2
description: Update assets, object presets, planet painting, and the global data of all planetary bodies in the Stanton system.

card.title: Stanton System Polish
card.description: Visual improvements to the Stanton system planets

title: StarHash Bind Culling
description: Bind Culling decides what entities are "bound" (network replicated) to which clients. Previously, the server would use the Entity Component Update Scheduler (ECUS) to determine visibility of entities for each client. This work introduces a StarHash maintained by the network code's Replication Layer to perform the same role. The StarHash is a data structure optimized for spatial queries, such as "what can this client see?"

title: StarWords Improvements
description: Quality of life and workflow improvements for StarWords, our text localization tool which handles most text within StarCitizen and Squadron 42.

title: StarWords [TMS]
description: Integrate internal text management tool with external TMS to allow for efficient localization.

title: Station Kit
description: This work aims to further improve assets required for building out space stations.

title: Substance Texturing Pipeline V1
description: Recreating our layerblend shader in substance painter and creating tools to support texturing in substance painter, allowing artists to have a visual library of materials.

title: Subsumption Editor Integration
description: Recreating the Subsumption editor's functionality inside the engine, to allow easier setup and debugging subsumption logic for the designers.

title: Subsumption Service/Server Mission Logic
description: The porting of core Subsumption mission code to a service and implementation of a select subset of tasks to be used on that service. Includes implementing communication between service and mission logic running on DGS.

title: Surrender
description: To allow players to be arrested without losing their life, they will be able to surrender by coming to a halt and powering down their ships when ordered to by security. Security will halt their attack and arrest criminal players (and impound the ship if owned by a criminal).

card.title: Law System v2: Surrender
card.description: Ability for criminals in ships to surrender to security rather than be killed

title: System Broadcaster
description: Implementing a system that enables the scheduling of various types of server-wide communications to players.

title: Take-Off and Landing
description: Design and implementation of take-off and landing procedures for the capital ships of Squadron 42.

title: Terrain Modification Support
description: Working with artists to support and improve the terrain modification tools. Adding features to better support organic landmarks like Rivers.

title: Terrain Snow Displacement
description: Implementing the tech required for impressions in the snow when a person or vehicle impacts/travels over snowy terrain.

title: TestRunner Improvements
description: TestRunner provides a standard setup for configuration files, build folder and data collection. These tasks will improve reporting to allow easier analysis of results, along with continuing work on Feature Testing support.

title: The Coil
description: The Coil is an electric phenomenon that exists in the unusually dense asteroid cluster that closely orbits the white dwarf Odin.

title: Theaters of War - Crossroads of Crime
